excerpt: Bustling sandy stretch lined with restaurants & resorts, a well-known spot for surfing & sunsets.
detail_description: Kuta Beach is a bustling sandy stretch in Bali, known for its vibrant atmosphere and stunning sunsets. It's a popular spot for surfing, especially for beginners due to the soft sand bar that makes wipeouts safer. Surf schools and instructors are readily available along the beach, offering lessons and board rentals. Away from the main beach area, Kuta is also famous for Waterbom, an acclaimed water park.
name: Kuta Beach
address: Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: Lively water park with a rides for all ages, plus restaurants, a food court & a swim-up bar.
detail_description: Waterbom Bali is a sprawling water park spanning 3.8 hectares, offering an array of rides and attractions suitable for all ages. It's a top family-friendly destination in Kuta, Bali. The park features exhilarating water slides, games, gardens, pools, and the steepest waterslide in Asia called The Climax. Visitors can also enjoy the Lazy River, Funtastic, Twin Racers, Fast N Fierce, Smashdown and more.
name: Waterbom Bali
address: Jl. Kartika Plaza, Tuban, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Chic open-air mall with popular international chain stores, restaurants & a central garden.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Kuta, Beachwalk Shopping Center is a stylish open-air mall that offers a unique shopping experience. The beautifully designed complex boasts an open concept with lush greenery and a serene atmosphere, making it an ideal place to indulge in retail therapy. Visitors can explore a wide array of popular international brands such as Adidas, H&M, Zara, Kate Spade, and more.
name: Beachwalk Shopping Center
address: Jl. Pantai Kuta, Kuta, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Museum with dozens of illusionistic 3D art works where visitors can take "trick" photos & selfies.
detail_description: Dream Museum Zone Bali (DMZ) is an indoor attraction in Kuta featuring a vast collection of illusionistic 3D art works. The gallery showcases over 120 unique artworks spread across three levels, designed to look interactive and perfect for taking 'trick' photos and selfies. Visitors can immerse themselves in various themed artworks that make it seem like they're in an Egyptian tomb, being chased by a shark, or surrounded by sprawling temple gardens and wildlife set pieces.
name: Dream Museum Zone Bali (DMZ)
address: Jl. Nakula No.33X, Legian, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Beachfront base of island environmental group protecting vulnerable turtle eggs in nesting season.
detail_description: The Bali Sea Turtle Society, located in Kuta, is a non-profit organization dedicated to protecting sea turtle nests and raising awareness about the illegal sea turtle trade. They work closely with local communities to safeguard vulnerable turtle eggs during nesting season. Visitors can learn about the seven species of turtles that inhabit Indonesia and witness baby turtles being released into the ocean. The society also offers opportunities for people to participate in releasing hatched turtles back into their natural habitat.
name: Bali Sea Turtle Society (BSTS)
address: Jl. Pantai Kuta, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Beachfront shopping complex offering department stores, boutiques, restaurants & cultural events.
detail_description: Discovery Mall Bali is a renowned beachfront shopping complex located in Badung, Bali, Indonesia. It is known for being one of the largest shopping centers in the province and offers a wide range of department stores, boutiques, restaurants, and cultural events. The mall's spacious building houses popular tenants such as Centro department store, Etude House, Fipper, Wakai Shoes, and electronic stores.
name: Discovery Mall Bali
address: Jl. Kartika Plaza, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Kuta is a beach and resort area in the south of the island of Bali, Indonesia. One of Bali's first tourist developments, it's best known for its party-centric atmosphere and surfing in the Indian Ocean. Kuta's long, consistent waves make it a popular surf spot, particularly for beginners, with plenty of outfitters offering board rentals and surf lessons.
detail_description: Kuta, located in the southern part of Bali, Indonesia, is a popular beach and resort area known for its vibrant party scene and excellent surfing opportunities in the Indian Ocean. The long and consistent waves make it an ideal spot for both beginner surfers and those looking to rent boards or take lessons. Additionally, visitors can enjoy unique entertainment at Centerstage at Hard Rock Hotel, which hosts special shows and performances by international celebrities.
name: Kuta
address: Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: West-facing beach region famous for its surfing & range of luxury holiday resorts.
detail_description: Seminyak is a popular west-facing beach area known for its excellent surfing opportunities and a wide range of luxurious holiday resorts. The region boasts an array of restaurants, cafes, and exclusive fashion boutiques, making it a vibrant destination for travelers seeking both relaxation and indulgence. Visitors can explore the main streets to discover smaller shops offering modern or ethnic chic clothing, as well as lifestyle brand outlets showcasing summer collections designed for Bali's tropical climate.
name: Seminyak
address: Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

detail_description: Sky Garden Bali is a renowned nightclub in Kuta, offering an unparalleled nightlife experience. With six different rooms across four floors, it boasts the newest and most modern setup on the island. The club features internationally acclaimed DJs and is known for its vibrant atmosphere with a diverse crowd. Additionally, visitors can enjoy the Sky Garden Lounge on the top floor, providing stunning views of Kuta during sunset.
name: Sky Garden Bali
address: Jln Legian No.60, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: Jl. Poppies Lane I is a bustling marketplace located in Bali, known for its array of cafes, bars, and shops. It's a hotspot for tourists seeking shopping opportunities and leisurely strolls. The market is particularly renowned for its surfboard offerings, with numerous well-known surf shops offering both ready-made and custom-designed boards.
name: Jl. Poppies Lane I
address: Kuta, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Relaxed beach popular with travelers offering umbrella rentals, live music & a chill ambiance.
detail_description: Double Six Beach is a popular destination for travelers seeking a relaxed atmosphere and vibrant entertainment. The beach offers umbrella rentals, live music, and a laid-back ambiance that appeals to families, couples, and young visitors alike. Renowned for its world-famous sunsets and excellent surf conditions, the beach also features charming bars such as La Plancha.
name: Double Six Beach
address: Legian, Jl. Double Six, Seminyak, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: Sloping white sand & tranquil waters are the draws at this scenic beach lined with cafes & hotels.
detail_description: Kedonganan Beach, located near Jimbaran Beach in Bali, is a popular destination known for its picturesque white sand and calm waters. Visitors can enjoy authentic seafood dishes and relax at resorts with stunning ocean views. The beach's gentle slope and tranquil waves make it perfect for sunset views and leisurely walks. Kedonganan Beach is also a haven for surfers, offering a 2km stretch of beach with popular surfing spots like Halfway Kuta.
name: Kedonganan Beach
address: Kedonganan, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: Family water park featuring high-speed slides, tube rides, a lazy river & pools for small kids.
detail_description: Circus Waterpark Kuta is a popular family-friendly water park located in the village of Tuban, Bali. It offers a variety of attractions including high-speed slides, tube rides, a lazy river, and pools for small kids. The park features Wave Slider, Kiddy Pool, Lazy River, Olympic Pool, Speed Tube Spiral, Spiral Journey, Speed Racing and more.
name: Circus Waterpark Kuta
address: 757G+33P, Jl. Kediri, Tuban, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: Kuta Beach Sea Turtle Conservation Center is a vital initiative in Bali, aiming to protect and nurture the precious turtle population. The center has successfully hatched and released numerous baby sea turtles into the ocean. Visitors can actively participate in this conservation effort by joining the daily turtle release activity between April and October at 4 pm. It's an educational experience for both adults and children, offering a unique opportunity to witness environmental conservation in action while contributing to the preservation of these remarkable creatures.
name: Kuta Beach Sea Turtle Conservation Center
address: Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Legian is a suburban and beach area on the west coast of Bali in Indonesia, just north of Kuta and south of Seminyak, the area between Jl. Melasti and Jl. Dhyana Pura. Administratively it is a district of Kuta District within Badung Regency. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Legian is a bustling suburban and beach area located on the western coast of Bali, Indonesia. Situated between Kuta and Seminyak, it offers a mix of traditional charm and modern amenities. The neighborhood is known for its narrow lanes lined with surf shops, cafes, and souvenir stores. While high-end hotels like Mercure Bali and Hard Rock Hotel dominate the area near Kuta Beach, there are also budget accommodations tucked away in the lanes.
name: Legian
address: Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: Wide sandy beach close to hotels, bars & cafes known for its sunset views & surfable waves.
detail_description: Legian Beach is a wide sandy stretch located between the bustling Kuta and upscale Seminyak. It's known for its stunning sunset views and surfable waves, making it a popular spot for both relaxation and water sports. The area around the beach is filled with shops, cafes, bars, and hotels, but has a more laid-back atmosphere compared to Kuta. While similar to its neighboring beaches, Legian offers a quieter experience with less crowds.
name: Legian Beach
address: Bali, Indonesia

detail_description: Pandora Experience Escape Room Bali offers an exciting escape game adventure in Kuta, catering to teams of two to fourteen players. Participants are challenged to solve a series of riddles and puzzles within a time limit of two hours. The experience promises surprises, secret passages, hidden chambers, and mind-boggling challenges that provide an exhilarating mental workout and adrenaline rush. It's a perfect indoor activity for rainy days or when seeking a break from beach relaxation.
name: Pandora Experience Escape Room Bali
address: Jl. Dewi Sri No.45 D, Legian, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bali's bustling tourist area, Kuta Art Market is a vibrant hub for souvenir shopping. Just a short stroll from Segara Beach, this market offers an extensive selection of authentic Balinese handicrafts and souvenirs. From colorful sarongs and hand-painted artworks to traditional clothing and inexpensive accessories like silver jewelry, visitors can find a wide range of items to commemorate their trip.
name: Kuta Art Market
address: Jl. Kuta Art Market No.18, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: 5GX Bali Reverse Bungy is an exhilarating experience that promises an adrenaline rush like no other. Seated inside a metal ball with up to two companions, you'll be launched into the air, soaring and spinning at incredible speeds for several minutes. Reaching heights of 60 meters in just over 2 seconds, this thrilling ride subjects you to forces of up to 5G.
name: 5GX Bali
address: Jalan Legian No.99, Legian, Kuta, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Colorful Buddhist temple with ornate, Chineseâ€“style architecture.
detail_description: The Dharmayana Temple, also known as Vihara Dharmayana, is a vibrant and ancient Buddhist temple located in Kuta, Bali. This Chinese-style temple dates back to 1876 and has been visited by the 14th Dalai Lama of Tibet. The temple's striking red walls and colorful decorations provide a serene escape from the bustling surroundings of Bali. With its intricate murals, lanterns, and dragon-themed decor, it offers a glimpse into Chinese Buddhist culture.
name: Dharmayana Temple
address: 75GH+F52, Jl. Blambangan, Legian, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: The Bali Shell Museum is a unique attraction in Indonesia, showcasing an extensive collection of shells in various shapes and sizes. Visitors can also admire fossilized specimens dating back hundreds of years and artistic items that represent the cultural heritage of Kuta. Even for those not particularly interested in shells, the museum offers a memorable experience. Located near the Carrefour shopping center on Sunset Road, it stands out among Bali's museums and art galleries with its unparalleled display of shell varieties and fine art pieces created from them.
name: Bali Shell Museum
address: Jl. Sunset Road No.819, Benoa, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Jimbaran is a fishing village and coastal resort south of Kuta on the Indonesian island of Bali. Jimbaran Bay has a long beach with calm waters. It's lined with fish restaurants and backed by tropical forest. At its northern end, colorful boats are pulled up by the lively, open-air Kedonganan fish market. Southwest of the bay are Dreamland Beach and Balangan Beach, known for their strong surf waves.
detail_description: Jimbaran is a charming fishing village and coastal resort located in Bali, Indonesia. The area boasts a long beach with tranquil waters and is famous for its seafood restaurants along the shore. Visitors can also explore the vibrant Kedonganan fish market at the northern end of Jimbaran Bay. Additionally, nearby Dreamland Beach and Balangan Beach are popular for their strong surf waves.
name: Jimbaran
address: South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: Long, narrow white-sand swimming & surfing beach with numerous oceanside seafood restaurants.
detail_description: Jimbaran Beach is one of Bali's top beaches, featuring a 4km stretch of clean white sand and a bustling atmosphere. The bay is protected by a coral reef, making it ideal for swimming and offering mellow surf breaks for bodysurfing. At sunset, the beach transforms as seafood restaurants set up tables on the sand, providing an opportunity to enjoy barbecued fish while watching planes land at Ngurah Rai International Airport.
name: Jimbaran Beach
address: Jimbaran, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: Dynamic retail hub with department stores, boutiques, a supermarket, eateries & a movie theater.
detail_description: Mal Bali Galeria, located on Pass Ngurah Rai in Kuta, is a small and cozy mall with a tropical and exotic theme. It features department stores, boutiques, a supermarket, eateries, and a movie theater. The mall underwent upgrades over the years and now includes an ACE Hardware store, a Hypermart supermarket, international fashion brand stores, and an expanded parking area.
name: Mal Bali Galeria
address: Jl. Bypass Ngurah Rai, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Striking monument & bombing memorial site with a name wall, floral offerings & a ring of flags.
detail_description: The Bali Bomb Memorial, also known as the Ground Zero Monument, is a poignant and well-maintained site in Kuta, Indonesia. It serves as a symbol of human resilience in the face of terror and commemorates the tragic 2002 bombings. The memorial features a name wall listing the 202 known victims from various countries, floral offerings, and a ring of flags. Visitors can spend contemplative moments paying their respects to those who lost their lives in this senseless act of violence.
name: Bali Bomb Memorial
address: Jln Legian, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Textile museum with interactive displays, rare batik cloth & historical fabrication tools.
detail_description: Museum Kain, situated on the third floor of the Beachwalk Shopping Complex in Kuta, is a unique textile museum offering an immersive experience into the world of Indonesian textiles. Visitors can explore interactive displays showcasing rare batik cloth and historical fabrication tools. The museum provides insight into the traditional art of batik-making, where wax is used to create intricate designs on fabric before dyeing. Guests can even try their hand at creating their own pieces with guidance from experts.
name: Museum Kain
address: Jl. Pantai Kuta E-1, Kuta, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Large, sandy beach offering swimming, sunbathing & boating, plus nearby restaurants.
detail_description: Tanjung Benoa Beach is a popular destination for water sports enthusiasts, offering a wide range of activities such as jet skiing, parasailing, banana boat rides, and snorkeling. Visitors can also enjoy the thrill of extreme flyboarding and showcase their wakeboarding skills. The beach provides complete water tourism facilities and easy access to nearby restaurants. Additionally, tourists can take luxury catamaran trips to Lembongan Island for kayaking and snorkeling experiences.
name: Tanjung Benoa Beach
address: Jl. Segara Kidul No.3x, Benoa, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Resort hotels & restaurants along a lengthy, coastal thoroughfare running parallel to Kuta Beach.
detail_description: Jl. Pantai Kuta is a bustling coastal thoroughfare that runs alongside Kuta Beach, offering an array of resort hotels, restaurants, and entertainment options. It is divided into three key areas: Bemo Corner, Midsection, and Beach Road. The street is lined with big hotel chains, small souvenir shops, and spa centers catering to various needs. Whether you're looking for a place to stay or indulge in shopping and dining experiences, this vibrant one-way street has it all.
name: Jl. Pantai Kuta
address: Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali, Indonesia

detail_description: Warung Indonesia, located in Gang Ronta Kuta, is a budget-friendly eatery offering authentic Indonesian cuisine. The menu includes a variety of dishes catering to the local palate at affordable prices. With options to order from the menu or select side dishes and vegetables, it provides flexibility for diners. Situated conveniently near Kuta Beach, this spot is perfect for those seeking traditional Indonesian fare such as soto ayam, gado-gado, and nasi pecel.
name: Warung Indonesia
address: Jl. Poppies II Gg. Ronta, Kuta, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Teater dengan kapasitas ruangan berAC untuk 500 orang, menampilkan cultural live show kisah nyata.
detail_description: Kuta Theatre is a popular tourist attraction in Kuta, Bali, known for its cultural live shows that combine contemporary Balinese arts and culture. The theater, located at Kuta Centre on Jalan Kartika Plaza, offers a 500-seat air-conditioned venue for visitors to enjoy the performances. The show features traditional Balinese dances like the Legong Dance alongside modern magic and illusions presented by skilled magicians and actors.
name: Kuta Theatre
address: DEE JAY CAFE, Jl. Kuta Center No.8X, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: The Bali Beer Cycle offers a unique and fun way to explore the sights of Bali with friends. Instead of the usual guided tours, you can hop on a 10 or 13-seater beer cycle and enjoy ice-cold beers while sightseeing. It's a great option for special occasions like birthdays, Hens Nights, or Bucks Night.
name: Bali Beer Cycle
address: Jln Legian No.210, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: Kuta Market is a bustling hub offering a variety of activities and experiences. Visitors can indulge in delicious street food or dine at local restaurants. The market is renowned for its affordable clothing, accessories, and unique souvenirs. It's the largest traditional market in the Kuta area, where one can find an array of spices and cooking ingredients at low prices. Additionally, visitors can sample Balinese snacks and refreshing coconut drinks.
name: Kuta Market
address: Jalan Raya, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: Kelan Beach, situated on the western side of Bali, is a serene and picturesque destination offering pristine golden sands and clear blue waters. It's a popular spot for sun-seekers, surfers, and beach enthusiasts in Kuta. The area is known for its variety of water activities and vibrant nightlife. Additionally, nearby Seminyak Beach provides a luxurious experience with an array of food and drink options.
name: Kelan Beach
address: 65V8+XJ2, Pantai Kelan, Tuban, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: White-sand cliff- & statue-lined beach for walking, swimming or paddling, with rentable chairs.
detail_description: Pandawa Beach, located in a limestone area, is known for its white-sand cliffs and statues lining the beach. It's a popular spot for walking, swimming, and paddling with rentable chairs available. Traditionally a fishing village just south of Kuta, Jimbaran offers tranquil pristine waves dotted with colorful boats along its coast. Despite being less developed in terms of tourism, it provides a perfect escape from the touristy Bali areas.
name: Pandawa Beach
address: Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: Small, white sand beach & surf break backed by cliffs, featuring sun bed rentals & restaurants.
detail_description: Dreamland Beach, located on the Bukit Peninsula in Bali, is a stunning hidden gem known for its pristine white sand and thrilling surf breaks. Tucked away behind impressive limestone cliffs, this secluded cove offers a picturesque setting with sun bed rentals and local restaurants. Visitors can enjoy the tranquility of the rugged coastline while indulging in professional massages on the beach or exploring quaint shops and street side stalls. It's a dreamy escape that captures the essence of Bali's natural beauty and vibrant culture.
name: Dreamland Beach
address: Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: Low-key, white-sand beach popular with surfers & sunset viewers, with a few eateries nearby.
detail_description: Balangan Beach is a low-key, white-sand beach that's popular among surfers and sunset enthusiasts. It offers a serene atmosphere with a few eateries nearby. Unlike the more upscale and chic Seminyak beach, Balangan remains fairly untouched by developers, making it an ideal spot for those seeking a peaceful beach experience without the crowds. The area provides plenty of sun chairs to relax in during low tide and some restaurants serving traditional Indonesian cuisine.
name: Balangan Beach
address: South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

detail_description: Gili Gili Fast Boat provides a seamless and comfortable travel experience. The pick-up was punctual, and the journey to the dock was pleasant. Check-in was hassle-free, and passengers were provided with amenities such as water, snacks, cold towels, and motion sickness pills. The air-conditioned cabin ensured a comfortable ride, while those who preferred outdoor views could opt for the upper deck. The arrival at Gili T was on time as per the booking.
name: Head Office Gili Gili Fast Boat
address: perkantoran simpangsiur, Jl. Setia Budi D-7, Kuta, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Park with paved paths & flower beds, plus fountains & a striking statue of mythical hero Gatotkaca.
detail_description: Satria Gatotkaca Park, located in Kuta, Bali, is a picturesque outdoor space named after a legendary Indonesian hero. The park boasts paved paths, flower beds, fountains, and a striking statue of the mythical hero Gatotkaca. It is strategically positioned near the airport and features stunning night lights. Despite traffic congestion in the area, it remains a popular gathering spot for locals and tourists alike.
name: Satria Gatotkaca Park
address: Jl. Raya Tuban No.1, Tuban, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

excerpt: Yellow sandy beach dotted with local outrigger fishing boats & resorts & restaurants.
detail_description: Tuban Beach is a picturesque yellow sandy beach located near the airport south of Kuta, Bali. It is known for its local outrigger fishing boats, resorts, and restaurants. The beach breaks here are suitable for beginners to learn surfing as they are protected by outer reefs called airport lefts and airport rights. This makes it an ideal place to practice paddling and balance on a surfboard in a quieter environment than Kuta.
name: Tuban Beach
address: Tuban, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

excerpt: Revered temple built to ward off dark forest spirits; traditional dress & fee required for entry.
detail_description: Masceti Temple, also known as Pura Petitenget, is a revered 16th-century Hindu temple located in Seminyak, Bali. This ancient religious site is built with stunning red brick and sandstone and is part of a series of sea temples protecting the island. Visitors are encouraged to wear traditional dress and pay an entry fee to enter the complex, which features small pavilions and shrines.
name: Masceti Temple
address: 8592+7X4, Jl. Petitenget, Kerobokan Kelod, Kuta Utara, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

detail_description: Kelan Beach Transport is a local favorite, attracting few foreign tourists. The beach bustles with fishermen, marine algae farmers, fishing boats, and cart merchants. Despite the crowds, visitors can still find moments of relaxation. What sets this beach apart is its proximity to Ngurah Rai airport's runway. Watching the sunset while planes land or take off in the background is a unique experience.
name: Kelan Beach Transport
address: Jl. Segara Madu No.Kelan, Tuban, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia

name: Pura Geger Dalem Pemutih
address: 56JF+7RH, Jl. Pura Geger, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali, Indonesia

detail_description: Ikat Gallery is a must-visit destination in Bali, known for its museum-quality Indonesian art and furniture. The gallery offers a luxurious selection of Indonesian antique furniture, home decor, jewelry, and textiles that have been hand-selected from various islands in Indonesia. Visitors can expect to find exclusive pieces transformed into luxury home decor that are not available anywhere else.
name: Ikat Gallery
address: JL. Raya Kerobokan No. 40 Br. Taman Seminyak, Kerobokan Kelod, Kec. Kuta Utara, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: Patung Dewa Ruci, also known as Dewa Ruci Bali, is a renowned statue in Kuta that captivates tourists with its depiction of Bhima from Hindu mythology retrieving the water of life. The intricate carvings and towering presence of the sculpture make it an unforgettable sight to behold. Located near Sunset Road and By Pass Ngurah Rai, this majestic statue has been rejuvenated with stunning lighting effects, making it a great spot for night photography.
name: Patung Dewa Ruci
address: Jl. Bypass Ngurah Rai No.120 AB, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

detail_description: St. Francis Xavier Catholic Church in Kuta is a beautiful church located opposite Lippo Mall. The parishioners are known for their warm welcome, and the Mass service is highly regarded. It's important to note that English mass is only available on Sundays at 6pm, while all other masses on weekdays and weekends are conducted in Bahese. Additionally, there's a dress code to adhere to when attending mass.
name: St. Francis Xavier Catholic Church
address: Jl. Kartika Plaza No.107, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia
